key_points: Oprah Winfrey's interview with Prince Harry and Meghan Markle aired on CBS, drawing over 17 million viewers.
The interview's success highlights Winfrey's savvy media strategy and the relevance of live-event television.
Winfrey has diversely engaged with multiple platforms, including a significant content deal with Apple and producing projects for Warner Bros.
The reported sale of the Harry and Meghan interview to CBS for $7 million underscores Winfrey's business acumen.
Experts, like Nancy Koehn from Harvard Business School, applaud Winfrey's ability to select the appropriate platform for different content.
The special achieved a 2.6 rating among adults ages 18 to 49, indicating strong interest from younger viewers.
Winfrey's continued influence in media contrasts with the streaming limitations of the CBS special due to existing deals.
Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are also noted for their media ventures with Netflix and Spotify.
Oprah Winfrey Network (OWN) is now 95 percent owned by Discovery, following Winfrey's sale of shares.
Winfrey's exchange of shares for Discovery stock exemplifies her strategic business movements, significantly increasing her investment's value.
